alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Lanai Leeward; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 31 at 3:48AM HST until January 31 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF LANAI UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THURSDAY... .A northwest (310 to 320 degree) swell will produce advisory level surf through today for exposed north and west facing shores. The northwest swell heights will gradually diminish from Wednesday to Thursday. This High Surf Advisory was extended through Thursday for the west facing shores of the Big Island. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 10 to 18 feet along north and 8 to 16 feet along west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu and Molokai. Surf heights of 10 to 15 feet along north facing shores of Maui, and 8 to 12 feet along west facing shores of Lanai. * WHERE...Portions of Kauai, Lanai, Maui, Molokai, Niihau and Oahu. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST this evening. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
